item.title: Let's talk about datatable in R
item.description: Tables Tables are the inevitable part of every data scientist or analyst job. There will always be a situation where data can be best communicated by simply displaying them in rectangular boxes. In those situation I resort to a smart and versatile datatable from DT package. library(DT) datatable(head(mtcars)) Okay if you think it comes with too may bells and whistle then herâ€™s a way to tune it down. And also by default datatable show 10 entries even though there is no 10 entries.
